üåÆ Work Experience

University of Florida

Gainesville, Florida

Dev Lead

June 2021 - Current

- Leading development team to build a Cloud Arduino IDE under Dr. Christina Gardner-McCune in Engaging Learning Lab.

- Managing web app scalability for classroom deployment to serve 10+ elementary schools and 200+ 3rd to 5th grade students.

Backend Developer

Feb 2021 - June 2021

- Built and maintained headless CMS of an interactive Arduino IDE Web App using Strapi.

- Remodeled compile server event listener to allow horizontal scaling and improved compile speed by 30%.

- Implemented Web Serial API to allow users to connect their USB and Bluetooth devices to the App.

üë©üèΩ‚ÄçüöÄ Projects

CaSMM - Computation and Science Modeling through Making Full Stack Web App

CASMM, or Computation and Science Modeling through Making, is a cloud-based programming interface designed for fifth and sixth grade students to support them in building computational physical models for science experiments in the classroom.

CASMM is developed by the University of Florida and Texas A&M University with support from the National Science Foundation.

CASMM makes use of Google's Blockly JavaScript library to build a block based visual programming editor within our user interface. Programs created through the visual programming editor can be compiled into Arduino executable code and uploaded directly onto a students Arduino. These programs, once uploaded to the student's Arduino, provide support in performing a corresponding science project in the classroom.

https://casmm-staging.herokuapp.com/

Frontend: React, Blockly

Backend: Node.js, Strapi, PostgresSQL

Compile Server: Arduino, Redis, Bull

Architecture: Docker, docker-compose, Github Action, Heroku

Check it out on Github
